hanzi-su-wiki:
畑

Значения

Поле

Мнемоника

Иероглиф японского происхождения. Суходольное поле 田, солома на котором сжигается 火.
purpleculture_pinyin:
tián
used in Japanese names with phonetic value hatake, bata etc; dry field (i.e. not paddy field)
используются в японских именах с фонетическим значением хатаке, бата и т. д .; сухое поле (т.е. не рисовое поле)
rtega_mnemonic:
畑畑RS
X		dry field
  • field 田 where it's possible to make a fire 火 and where weeds are burned as fertilizer
土 原 野

畑畑RSdry (as opposed to rice) field, farm, garden
  • field 田 where fire 火 can burn (used as fertilizer)
土 原 野 秋
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A dry 火 field 田; 田 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
小畑健 [ xiǎo tián jiàn ]: OBATA Takeshi, manga artist, illustrator of cult series Death Note 死亡笔记
高畑勋 [ gāo tián xūn ]: Isao Takahata (1935-2018), co-founder of Studio Ghibli
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 火 [ huǒ ] fire, flame; to burn; anger, rage
    • 田 [ tián ] field, farm, arable land; cultivated
heisig_keyword: farm | ферма, hearth очаг, womb лоно
heisig_story: Looking at the primitives, a fireplace and a rice field, we find the essential ingredients for a farm: a warm hearth to sit by at night, and a well-plowed field to grow one's crops in by day.
koohiiStory1: Many farms are created by first setting FIRE over the land to clear the land for the FIELDS.
koohiiStory2: When creating a farm, the prospective farmer must first set fire to the forest to clear the ground. Only then can he plow the fields. Fire before fields to make a farm.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A fire in the rice paddy burns down the field. The rice paddy fire spreads out from the paddy and consumes the field next to it. This rice paddy fire has ravaged your entire farm!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at this fire burning the rice paddy and the surrounding field. Smell burnt rice in the air as you see the flames dance before your eyes.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your rice paddy farm and field are on a cay. A cay is a small, sandy island, and since your farm is on fire, this cay has turned into a hot cay. Or as Mario would say, that’s one-a hot-a cay! (はたけ) Mama mia!
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
Imagine running around this hot cay as you try to put out the fire in your field. The fire is ravaging the entire hot cay, so it takes you a while to put it out. Man those flames are hot.
Also, this kanji can have the reading はた for the kun'yomi as well. If you learn the longer version (はたけ) it will be easier to just shave off a kana to remember the shorter version.
Ru_trainchinese: tián: (графема) (японский иероглиф) сухая земля (часто используется в японских именах)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you set the rice field (田) on fire (火) after you've cultivated it

畑(はたけ): field

畑字的基本解释

畑
tián
旱地，多用作日本人姓名。

畑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tián］
日本和字。

畑字的康熙字典解释

Hatta
Name meaning
Japanese names use characters.
tián
яп. суходольное поле (также используется в японских именах)
Radicals: 火, 田  (fire, rice-paddy)
Meaning Mnemonic
A fire in the rice paddy burns down the field. The rice paddy fire spreads out from the paddy and consumes the field next to it. This rice paddy fire has ravaged your entire farm!
Look at this fire burning the rice paddy and the surrounding field. Smell burnt rice in the air as you see the flames dance before your eyes.
Reading Mnemonic
Your rice paddy farm and field are on a cay. A cay is a small, sandy island, and since your farm is on fire, this cay has turned into a hot cay. Or as Mario would say, that’s one-a hot-a cay! (はたけ) Mama mia!
Imagine running around this hot cay as you try to put out the fire in your field. The fire is ravaging the entire hot cay, so it takes you a while to put it out. Man those flames are hot.
Also, this kanji can have the reading はた for the kun'yomi as well. If you learn the longer version (はたけ) it will be easier to just shave off a kana to remember the shorter version.
